resources.string: Take medications at the same time daily. Use a pill organizer. Set alarms or reminders on devices. Link medication doses to daily routines. Involve caregivers or family members if needed. Store medications in visible locations. Schedule regular medication reviews. Organize medications by different times of day. Use large, clear labels on medication bottles. Check for potential interactions with healthcare providers. Keep an updated list of all medications. Regularly check vision and hearing. Use easy-to-open containers if needed. Stay hydrated to aid swallowing. Read labels before taking medications. Store medications safely and away from children. Report any side effects to healthcare providers. Maintain a balanced diet and regular exercise. Consider simpler dosing schedules. Communicate changes to healthcare providers.
